profile.name: Aakrity Singh
profile.title: Product Manager & UX Researcher
profile.summary: Product Manager and UX Researcher with expertise in AI/GenAI products, behavioral analytics, and responsible AI implementation. Currently pursuing Masters in Information Management at University of Washington with specialization in Product Management, Data Science, and Cybersecurity. Proven track record of driving 30% adoption lifts through data-driven product strategy, user research, and cross-functional collaboration. Passionate about building inclusive, ethical AI products that solve real user problems.

caseStudies.title: PulseNet+ Behavioral Sentiment Dashboard
caseStudies.subtitle: Building responsible AI through user trust analytics
caseStudies.description: Led the development of PulseNet+, a behavioral sentiment dashboard that tracks user trust signals across diverse groups to inform data-driven roadmap decisions aligned with Responsible AI principles.
caseStudies.challenge: AI/GenAI products lacked comprehensive user trust monitoring, making it difficult to identify bias, accessibility issues, and trust gaps across different user demographics. Traditional analytics didn't capture nuanced behavioral sentiment data needed for responsible AI development.
caseStudies.solution: Built a comprehensive behavioral sentiment dashboard using SQL, Figma, and advanced analytics to track user trust signals across diverse populations. Integrated real-time monitoring with cross-functional teams including AI Ethics, Engineering, and Design to embed responsible AI guidelines into product development.
results: Established continuous feedback loops with 50+ user interviews across vulnerable populations
Improved product trust metrics across diverse user groups
Enabled data-driven roadmap decisions aligned with Responsible AI principles
Created framework for ongoing bias mitigation and accessibility improvements

caseStudies.title: Women's Wellness & Mental Health Tracker
caseStudies.subtitle: Driving 30% adoption through inclusive UX design
caseStudies.description: Scoped MVP and prioritized features for a women's wellness and mental health tracker, focusing on hormone-cycle personalization and inclusive UX design to drive significant adoption improvements.
caseStudies.challenge: Existing wellness apps lacked personalization for women's unique health needs, particularly around hormone cycles and mental health correlations. Generic approaches resulted in low engagement and poor user retention among the target demographic.
caseStudies.solution: Conducted extensive user research with women across different demographics, designed hormone-cycle personalization features, and implemented inclusive UX design principles. Collaborated with healthcare experts and used behavioral analytics to optimize the user experience.
results: Achieved 30% adoption lift through personalized features
Improved user retention through inclusive design approach
Enhanced mental health tracking with hormone-cycle correlation
Created scalable framework for women's health product development

caseStudies.title: Hugging Face GenAI Tool UX Strategy
caseStudies.subtitle: Mapping UX friction and trust gaps for ethical AI
caseStudies.description: Led design sprint to define product vision and strategy for Hugging Face's GenAI tool by mapping UX friction points and trust gaps, integrating multiple AI models for responsible innovation.
caseStudies.challenge: GenAI tools faced significant UX friction and trust issues that hindered user adoption and ethical implementation. Users struggled with complex interfaces and lacked confidence in AI-generated outputs, particularly around bias and reliability concerns.
caseStudies.solution: Conducted comprehensive design sprint using Figma and SQL dashboards to map UX friction points. Led research integrating GPT-4, Claude, and Gemini to evaluate GenAI tool UX. Collaborated with cross-functional teams to embed responsible AI guidelines into the product development process.
results: Identified and mapped key UX friction points across the user journey
Established trust framework for GenAI tool interactions
Created comprehensive product vision and strategy documentation
Integrated multiple AI models for comparative UX evaluation

experience.description: Leading product research and strategy for AI/GenAI tools with focus on responsible AI implementation and user experience optimization.

Built PulseNet+, a behavioral sentiment dashboard tracking user trust signals across diverse groups, informing data-driven roadmap decisions aligned with Responsible AI principles
Scoped MVP and prioritized features for a women's wellness and mental health tracker, driving a 30% adoption lift through hormone-cycle personalization and inclusive UX design
Partnered cross-functionally with Software Engineering, Design, and AI Ethics teams to embed accessibility, bias mitigation, and Responsible AI guidelines into product development
Conducted 50+ user interviews and usability tests with vulnerable populations, establishing continuous customer feedback loops to improve retention and usability

experience.description: Managed product implementation and go-to-market strategy for hotel API pricing integration with cross-functional teams.

Established and tracked OKRs, prioritized backlog across Engineering, PM, and Sales, increasing project velocity and stakeholder alignment
Developed onboarding documentation, demo scripts, and rollout emails, reducing support tickets by 18% and enhancing adoption
Partnered cross-functionally to identify feature priorities, customer acquisition strategies, and product release criteria
